Comments_List: Learned more about Indonesian culture and the language
Learned SO much about bahasa Indonesia and the culture of Indonesia. Learned a bit about Indonesian music and traditional arts.
I know all about the Indonesian culture and how to speaking Indonesian
I learned more about Indonesian language, culture, history, as well as society and politics

Strengths: Indriyo is a gem. Yudhis is the single best TA at all of Yale and it's a shame he leaves after this semester'

Weaknesses: if you like rigid organization, this may not be a fit for you.
This class is amazing there are no complaints
This is the greatest course ever -- email communication could be better though.

Instructors are friendly and nice. But course is poorly organized, class is not engaging, we barely learnt anything beyond L1, and we are constantly unaware of our grades or where we stand in class. We barely get any feedback on how we are doing in class, and class material is almost never returned.

The professors brought in a diverse repository of knowledge about everything Indonesian, and always made it a point to make lessons interesting. However, I personally feel like the learning curve could be steeper and perhaps more grammar/ vocabulary introduced! Having more tests along the way might be helpful too.

Ab-so-lutely. Indonesian is underrated because it actually is somewhat useful and super interesting. The course also features a lot about the cultural aspects of Indonesia, which is so fun! Cake and music and dancing and more.
Definitely! The professors and TAs are very helpful and friendly and it's been wonderful learning about Indonesia from them.
